# Download USB Drivers for Android Phones {#download-usb-drivers-for-android-phones .entry-title}

::: {.gb-container .gb-container-8a25fc79 .inline-post-meta-area}

::: entry-content
Download USB driver for Windows OS. USB Drivers play an essential role
in communicating an Android smartphone with the operating system of a
computer. It is the essential software that needs to be installed on a
computer for accessing any Android phone or tablet.

::: {.code-block .code-block-12 style="margin:8px 0;clear:both"}
[]{#ezoic-pub-ad-placeholder-191}[[]{#div-gpt-ad-droidthunder_com-medrectangle-3-0
.ezoic-ad ezaw="728" ezah="90"
style="position:relative;z-index:0;display:inline-block;padding:0;min-height:90px;min-width:728px"}]{.ezoic-ad
.medrectangle-3 .medrectangle-3191 .adtester-container
.adtester-container-191 ez-name="droidthunder_com-medrectangle-3"}
:::

Moreover, you can perform various tasks such as transferring or copying
data, syncing a device with a computer, setting up ADB and Fastboot,
using the Odin tool, and flash official stock firmware for Samsung.

![Download USB Drivers for Android
phones](https://www.droidthunder.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/Download-USB-Drivers-for-Android-phones.jpg?ezimgfmt=rs%3Adevice%2Frscb79-1){.aligncenter
.wp-image-22116 width="576" height="358" srcset="" sizes=""
ezimgfmt="rs rscb79 src ng ngcb79 srcset" loading="eager"
importance="high"}

Besides, you can flash unofficial custom ROMs, install TWRP recovery.
Most important, you can even use Sony Flashtool and SuperOneClick to
root Android phones. Additionally, you can record an Android phone
screen on a computer with MirrorGo or Dr.Fone,
etc.[]{#ezoic-pub-ad-placeholder-651
.ezoic-adpicker-ad}[[]{#div-gpt-ad-droidthunder_com-medrectangle-4-0
.ezoic-ad ezaw="300" ezah="250"
style="position:relative;z-index:0;display:inline-block;padding:0;min-height:250px;min-width:300px"}]{.ezoic-ad
.medrectangle-4 .medrectangle-4651 .adtester-container
.adtester-container-651 ez-name="droidthunder_com-medrectangle-4"}

Almost every manufacturer provides USB drivers with the handset package
itself. For a Windows Operating System, the USB drivers are
automatically installed once you connect a device for the first time.

::: {.code-block .code-block-1 style="margin:8px 0;clear:both"}
:::

But for Mac OSx and Linux OS, you need to install the drivers from a
manufacturer's website manually. If you are having trouble looking for
the original valid USB drivers for your device, then your wait is over.

In this guide, you'll get direct download links to USB drivers for the
most popular Android smartphones/tablets. Some of which include Samsung,
Motorola, OnePlus, Google, Xiaomi, Vivo, Realme, Oppo, Sony, Dell, LG,
HTC, etc.

Also, we'll discuss some easy step-by-step procedures on how to install
these drivers on your Windows or Mac operating system.

**Disclaimer:** The Android Drivers given below belong to the respective
brands. If a specific downloaded USB driver does not work for you, then
kindly visit the official website of your Android device.

        these [ADB drivers](https://www.droidthunder.com/adb-drivers/),
        [CDC](https://www.droidthunder.com/download-cdc-drivers/), and
        [VCOM
        drivers](https://www.droidthunder.com/download-mediatek-mt65xx-usb-vcom-drivers/).
        I hope this helps.
